alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:49PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ohio County through 215 PM CDT... At 148 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartford, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Ohio County, including the following locations... Jingo, Rosine, Horton, Windy Hill, Select, Beaver Dam, Rob Roy, Sandefur Crossing, Cromwell and Baizetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
